questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> tag defines the most important (largest) heading. HTML has six levels of headings, from h1 (largest) to h6 (smallest).

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> tag with the href attribute is used to create hyperlinks in HTML. The href attribute specifies the URL the link goes to.

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
questions.explanation: The <footer> element defines a footer for a document or section. It typically contains authorship, copyright, contact info, etc.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for inserting an image?
questions.explanation: The tag is used to embed images in HTML. The src attribute specifies the path to the image, and alt provides alternative text for accessibility.
